image.altText: Two women smiling at camera, one is holding a birthday cake with lit candles

props.synopsis: Helen's mother died at 99 after a stroke, but was "quite happy to go" long before that. Her daughter is now a passionate advocate for changes to WA's voluntary assisted dying laws, which are only accessible to those with a terminal diagnosis.

title.children: After watching her mother die over 11 days, Helen wants WA's voluntary euthanasia laws expanded

image.altText: A rendering of the planned apartment building on Hood Street, Subiaco, showing ground floor shops, balconies with plants

props.synopsis: Six new social housing units slated for the heart of Subiaco may no longer go ahead, with the developers of a planned apartment complex looking to strike them from the build, citing construction costs.

title.children: Social housing slated for Subiaco on the chopping block, as developer cites construction costs

image.altText: Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: National cabinet has agreed to a $4.7 billion plan to ramp up frontline legal support for people escaping family violence.

title.children: National cabinet promises $4.7 billion plan for frontline family violence services

image.altText: Jacqueline McGowan-Jones wears a purple jacket and has a serious expression.

props.synopsis: WA's top child advocate watched in horror as the government referenced her "glowing" assessment of the youth detention centre where another teenage boy died in custody, and was devastated her observations were taken "out of context".

title.children: 'Devastated' children's commissioner claims WA government misrepresented her in wake of detainee death

image.altText: Broome Police on the way to investigate an incident at the sandunes

props.synopsis: Police say a woman who was bashed and sexually assaulted at a Cable Beach 'bush doof' lives with the aftermath of the attack.

title.children: 'I believe it can be solved': Landmark $250k reward offered over violent sex assault in Broome

image.altText: Signage at Fitzroy Valley District High School.

props.synopsis: Education department data for 14 secondary schools in the Kimberley shows just 41 per cent of public high school students are regularly attending, and at some schools in remote communities it's below 10 per cent.

title.children: Fewer than half of students in WA's far north attend secondary school

props.synopsis: The comments come after a week in which Treasurer Jim Chalmers and RBA governor Michele Bullock downplayed suggestions of a rift.

title.children: PM affirms 'respect' for Reserve Bank after Wayne Swan likens interest rate strategy to a punch in the face

image.altText: Donald Trump and Kamala Harris speak into microphones in two side-by-side images.

props.synopsis: After plenty of haggling, the Donald Trump and Kamala Harris camps have agreed to some rules for the first presidential debate. But neither side is entirely happy.

title.children: The Trump-Harris debate rules have been released, and both sides are complaining

image.altText: A woman hold a photo of her son.

props.synopsis: The governor-general will soon receive the final report of the Royal Commission into Defence and Veterans Suicide. Grieving families are hoping it will lead to lasting change.

title.children: '3,000 veterans dead': This grieving mother has led the fight for all of them

image.altText: A couple hold hands with a child with the family court building in the background.

props.synopsis: A world-renowned expert hopes to change the culture of "mother blaming" he says has permeated the agencies dealing with family violence.

title.children: 'We need to have higher expectations for men as parents': Family violence expert reveals the myths and biases that unravel family court cases

image.altText: A little girl with a pink cap, smiling

props.synopsis: Multiple members of a religious group charged over the death of eight-year-old Elizabeth Struhs have told a court she will be resurrected and will rise again more than two years after her death.

title.children: Religious group members accused of eight-year-old's death believe she will be resurrected, court hears

props.synopsis: While some places have seen record winter rainfall, another sets a new all-time state and national temperature record for the coldest season.

title.children: Perth clocks the most winter rainy days in 28 years, as hail hits southern suburbs

image.altText: A man speaking to a crowd of tradespeople

props.synopsis: Police won't lay criminal charges against John Setka after he addressed CFMEU members at two Melbourne worksites this week.

title.children: No trespass charges over former CFMEU boss John Setka's appearance at worksites

image.altText: Man, left, walks out of court wearing a suit with blonde-haired woman on right

props.synopsis: Judge Mark Scarsi tells Hunter Biden he faces up to 17 years in prison and up to $US450,000 in penalties.

title.children: Hunter Biden pleads guilty in federal tax case

image.altText: Kim Woo-min at the medal ceremony alongside Elijah Winnington

props.synopsis: Michael Palfrey has been given his marching orders over controversial comments made ahead of the men's 400m freestyle event at the Paris Olympics.

title.children: Swimming Australia sacks coach Michael Palfrey over 'Go Korea' comment at Olympics

image.altText: A man standing at a lectern, spreading his arms and shrugging.

props.synopsis: Bill Shorten has had an enormous impact on the NDIS. When he leaves parliament next year, there will be no shortage of challenges for whoever steps in as minister, write Nas Campanella and Evan Young.

title.children: Bill Shorten is leaving politics. The next NDIS minister better be ready to roll up their sleeves

image.altText: A man walking down a street wearing a black t shirt

props.synopsis: George Alex was supposed to appear in court today after being found guilty over a $10 million ATO fraud but he was instead in rehab being treated for an opioid addiction.

title.children: Sydney construction boss in custody after failing to attend court over $10m scam

image.altText: A medical helicopter and several police cars outside of a school

props.synopsis: Authorities charge 14-year-old murder accused as an adult after the shootings at Apalachee High School, outside Atlanta.

title.children: Father of US school shooting suspect arrested on various charges

image.altText: A man at a cash register.

props.synopsis: With freight adding up to 50 per cent to their cost of living, Lord Howe Islanders find ways to manage the price of living in paradise.

title.children: With petrol $4 a litre and rice $9 a kilo, Lord Howe island residents get creative to keep costs down

image.altText: An older woman with a brown bob wearing round sunglasses speaks into multiple microphones looking sad

props.synopsis: Gisele Picot is calm and composed as she recounts the moment she realised her husband of 50 years had repeatedly drugged her and invited strangers to sexually assault her in their home.

title.children: Victim recounts 'scenes of horror' as French trial is told husband drugged and raped her for a decade

image.altText: police gather on a sporting girl

props.synopsis: As authorities investigate a hammer-throwing incident which critically injured a 13-year-old boy at a suburban Adelaide athletics ground, police say the "tragic" situation appears to have been the result of an "incredibly unfortunate accident".

title.children: Teenage hammer-throwing victim 'fighting for his life' after 'tragic' accident at suburban sports ground

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Australian shares are trading higher after mixed results on Wall Street. Tesla pushed up the tech-heavy Nasdaq, while jobs data in the US will have major implications for interest rates. Follow the day's events and insights on the live markets blog.

title.children: Australian shares trading higher despite GDP and rates woes as investors await US jobs data

image.altText: A man with short black hair looks neutrally at the camera alongside a woman with straight black hair talking behind a microphone

props.synopsis: Indonesia has already sent Alice Guo to the Philippines, with officials saying the negotiation over sending Gregor Haas on drug trafficking charges is ongoing.

title.children: Father of NRL star accused of drug trafficking could be sent to Indonesia in exchange for accused Chinese spy

image.altText: A poster of Israeli hostage Eliya Cohen smiling with the words 'Bring him home now' is sticky taped to a wall with graffiti

props.synopsis: As the bodies of six Israeli hostages are recovered from Gaza, questions surround the status of those who remain captive nearly a year since the October 7 attack.

title.children: What we know about the remaining Hamas hostages

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann walks into court.

props.synopsis: The former Liberal staffer has been given extra time to file amended grounds of appeal, as he seeks to overturn the result of his failed defamation case.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's lawyer defends missed deadlines in attempt to overturn defamation ruling

image.altText: Edwina Bartholomew cancer announcement

props.synopsis: Edwina Bartholomew has shared on-air that she has chronic myeloid leukaemia and remains "really positive" about her diagnosis.

title.children: Sunrise presenter Edwina Bartholomew reveals she has cancer

image.altText: A woman in a blue beanie grins for the camera.

props.synopsis: A group of 23 Catholics ventured through tough island terrain for a chance to see the pope as he visits Papua New Guinea.

title.children: This granny defied her family to trek four days through the Kokoda Track to see the pope

image.altText: Patchy snow slope with mounds of dirt dotted through it

props.synopsis: Tourism operators and the broader Snowy Mountains region are looking to summer tourism options as they face the prospect of warmer winters and shorter ski seasons.

title.children: This year's ski season ended far earlier than usual, prompting soul-searching among operators

image.altText: Liam Gallagher leans with an arm slung over his brother Noel's shoulder.

props.synopsis: Uber, Qantas, Virgin and more all use price surging to help their ticket prices match demand. It's a completely legal practice, and Live Nation says it plans to roll it out for concert tickets here in Australia.

title.children: Thanks to Oasis, dynamic pricing has come under fresh scrutiny in the UK. Live Nation says Australia is next

image.altText: A white beluga whale wearing a harness in the sea

props.synopsis: OneWhale and NOAH, two prominent animal rights organisations, suspect Hvaldimir was deliberately killed and suffered gun shot wounds.

title.children: Russian 'spy whale' Hvaldimir may have been shot to death in Norway, animal rights groups say

image.altText: a student with a blonde pony tail putting her hand up

props.synopsis: When it comes to deciding between single-sex and co-education, it's a debate that invokes deeply held beliefs about which type is "better".

title.children: Principals weigh in over whether single-sex or co-educational schools are 'better'

image.altText: Two men celebrate winning a tennis match

props.synopsis: A major payday and a chance at glory will be on the line for Jordan Thompson and Max Purcell after they powered through to the US Open doubles final after victory over American pair Nathaniel Lammons and Jackson Withrow.

title.children: Aussie duo Jordan Thompson and Max Purcell edge closer to major redemption after making US Open final

image.altText: Melissa Tapper prepares to serve at the Paris Olympics

props.synopsis: Several Paralympic athletes over the years have competed in both the Olympics and Paralympic Games, but what does this mean for the value of the Paralympic movement?

title.children: Being able to compete at both the Olympics and Paralympics is a rare feat. But does it damage the Paralympic movement?

image.altText: The six members of Linkin Park pose against a dark grey backrdop

props.synopsis: No longer numb: Linkin Park have announced their first new music and live shows since 2017. But who is their new singer? And what is the fan reaction?

title.children: Linkin Park return with new singer, seven years on from Chester Bennington's shock death
